[HEADING] The Stanford MBA Program Is Designed to Help You

Change lives, change organizations, change the world. Our motto is more than words — ideas started here have fundamentally changed how the world works, connects, and lives.
During your time at business school there is another change a little less quantifiable — an internal change that occurs as students become leaders by challenging themselves intellectually, engaging and collaborating with their equally driven peers, and gaining global exposure
No matter the end goal, our full-time, two-year MBA program will help you become a stronger leader and a better person. Immersing yourself in the program in person on campus allows for a transformative experience. Find out more about how your time at Stanford can change you.
Join Stanford Graduate School of Business Admissions for a series of upcoming Information Sessions around the world.
These events are a great opportunity to learn more about our MBA program, connect with our admissions team, and hear firsthand from alumni and students about their experiences. You’ll gain insights into our application process, academic offerings, and the vibrant GSB community.
Stanford GSB, with our campus in the heart of Silicon Valley, is a one-of-a-kind MBA program that has redefined the business school experience. Here, you’ll be pushed and challenged by best-in-class faculty and supported by your classmates in an environment unlike anywhere else. Collaboration, not competition, is key in a Stanford classroom. You’ll work closely with students from all around the world and of all different backgrounds. Against the backdrop of beautiful California days, you’ll find life-long collaborators, mentors, and friends.
Learn more about what it means to be part of the Stanford community, or explore more in the links below.
A master’s degree from Stanford will take you wherever you want to go, but you have to take the first step. A great place to start your Stanford journey is at an admissions event. These virtual or in-person events will show you how Stanford GSB can transform your life and career. Admissions events include MBA information sessions, panels, small group chats, and other opportunities to engage with students, alumni, and admissions staff around the world.
Tens of thousands of Stanford GSB alumni from around the world are hard at work, right now, changing lives, changing organizations, and changing the world. You can join them.
It all starts at Stanford. It all starts with your application.
Create or update your MBA Profile! Head to the MyStanfordGSB.Info page to see a personalized dashboard for your MBA journey. The MyStanfordGSB prospect portal helps you track your application progress, register for upcoming events, and engage with stories and content relevant to you.
Finances can be a sensitive topic, but we’ll address it plainly: your financial situation should not hold you back from applying. Obtaining an MBA is a significant investment in you and your future. We want to make sure that investment is a reasonable one.
We believe in accessible and attainable higher education for all and our Financial Aid Office will work with you to find the right resources for your needs. Whatever your citizenship status, whatever your financial status, once admitted, we want you here. We can help you fund your MBA through a combination of fellowship awards, student loans, summer stipends, social impact loan forgiveness programs, and other types of financial aid.

Stanford MBA Program










Change lives, change organizations, change the world. Our motto is more than words — ideas started here have fundamentally changed how the world works, connects, and lives.










Change starts here.
During your time at business school there is another change a little less quantifiable — an internal change that occurs as students become leaders by challenging themselves intellectually, engaging and collaborating with their equally driven peers, and gaining global exposure
The Stanford MBA Program Is Designed to Help You
No matter the end goal, our full-time, two-year MBA program will help you become a stronger leader and a better person. Immersing yourself in the program in person on campus allows for a transformative experience. Find out more about how your time at Stanford can change you.




































Why Stanford MBA 













Download the MBA Brochure  













Stanford GSB is on the road!

Join Stanford Graduate School of Business Admissions for a series of upcoming Information Sessions around the world.
These events are a great opportunity to learn more about our MBA program, connect with our admissions team, and hear firsthand from alumni and students about their experiences. You’ll gain insights into our application process, academic offerings, and the vibrant GSB community.









Attend an Event 














  An Experience Unlike Any Other
Stanford GSB, with our campus in the heart of Silicon Valley, is a one-of-a-kind MBA program that has redefined the business school experience. Here, you’ll be pushed and challenged by best-in-class faculty and supported by your classmates in an environment unlike anywhere else. Collaboration, not competition, is key in a Stanford classroom. You’ll work closely with students from all around the world and of all different backgrounds. Against the backdrop of beautiful California days, you’ll find life-long collaborators, mentors, and friends.
Learn more about what it means to be part of the Stanford community, or explore more in the links below.


















Academic Experience 














Student Life 














Career Impact 











  Admissions: Taking the First Step
A master’s degree from Stanford will take you wherever you want to go, but you have to take the first step. A great place to start your Stanford journey is at an admissions event. These virtual or in-person events will show you how Stanford GSB can transform your life and career. Admissions events include MBA information sessions, panels, small group chats, and other opportunities to engage with students, alumni, and admissions staff around the world.
































Tens of thousands of Stanford GSB alumni from around the world are hard at work, right now, changing lives, changing organizations, and changing the world. You can join them.
It all starts at Stanford. It all starts with your application.














Learn More About Admission and Application 













Join Us at an Admissions Event 














  Personalize Your Admissions Journey at MyStanfordGSB
Create or update your MBA Profile! Head to the MyStanfordGSB.Info page to see a personalized dashboard for your MBA journey. The MyStanfordGSB prospect portal helps you track your application progress, register for upcoming events, and engage with stories and content relevant to you.














Go to MyStanfordGSB 














  Financial Aid: We’ll Help You Get Here
Finances can be a sensitive topic, but we’ll address it plainly: your financial situation should not hold you back from applying. Obtaining an MBA is a significant investment in you and your future. We want to make sure that investment is a reasonable one.
We believe in accessible and attainable higher education for all and our Financial Aid Office will work with you to find the right resources for your needs. Whatever your citizenship status, whatever your financial status, once admitted, we want you here. We can help you fund your MBA through a combination of fellowship awards, student loans, summer stipends, social impact loan forgiveness programs, and other types of financial aid.









Millions in Financial Aid Awarded Each Year

                      MBA ’25
                  

          I’m a doer — roll up your sleeves, create a strategy, and bring people together. That brings me energy.

                      MBA ’24

                  MBA ’24
              





















Gabriela Diaz


                      MBA ’25

                  MBA ’25

  Admissions: Taking the First Step
A master’s degree from Stanford will take you wherever you want to go, but you have to take the first step. A great place to start your Stanford journey is at an admissions event. These virtual or in-person events will show you how Stanford GSB can transform your life and career. Admissions events include MBA information sessions, panels, small group chats, and other opportunities to engage with students, alumni, and admissions staff around the world.

  Financial Aid: We’ll Help You Get Here
Finances can be a sensitive topic, but we’ll address it plainly: your financial situation should not hold you back from applying. Obtaining an MBA is a significant investment in you and your future. We want to make sure that investment is a reasonable one.
We believe in accessible and attainable higher education for all and our Financial Aid Office will work with you to find the right resources for your needs. Whatever your citizenship status, whatever your financial status, once admitted, we want you here. We can help you fund your MBA through a combination of fellowship awards, student loans, summer stipends, social impact loan forgiveness programs, and other types of financial aid.

Change starts here.
During your time at business school there is another change a little less quantifiable — an internal change that occurs as students become leaders by challenging themselves intellectually, engaging and collaborating with their equally driven peers, and gaining global exposure
The Stanford MBA Program Is Designed to Help You
No matter the end goal, our full-time, two-year MBA program will help you become a stronger leader and a better person. Immersing yourself in the program in person on campus allows for a transformative experience. Find out more about how your time at Stanford can change you.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Curriculum in the MBA Program
[HEADING] Let the Learning Begin
[HEADING] Transform in Two Years
[HEADING] First Year
[HEADING] Second Year
[HEADING] World-Class Centers
[HEADING] Support to Stay On Track
Ready to change your trajectory and the world around you? The Stanford MBA Program will help you develop and hone your skills to make a positive difference in the world.
In two years, you’ll immerse yourself in a curriculum that is theoretical and practical. Foundational and cutting edge. Rigorous and demanding. We challenge you both inside and outside the classroom, so you’re ready to lead wherever you go.
What you learn, how you learn, and who you learn from makes all the difference. We build your knowledge throughout your education with real-life scenarios.
Our comprehensive, experiential curriculum is designed to shape the next generation of leaders, industry disruptors, and change makers.
Our MBA Program is the launching pad to a more impactful and meaningful career. Gain a strong foundation in your first year, and then forge your own path.
Your first year in the Stanford MBA Program is invaluable. This is where you establish your foundation, begin to develop your managerial skills and style, and broaden your global perspective.
Coursework mainly consists of core and distribution requirements. You’ll gain insights from world-class researchers and senior leaders and a deeper understanding of effective business management.
Students must complete a global experience requirement. This is an opportunity to engage with global issues and expand your mindset.
Year two is about pursuing your path. Coursework entirely consists of electives. You’ll strengthen your areas of expertise, explore new subjects, and round out your general management education.
You can tailor your experience through an abundance of electives, seminars, a joint or dual degree, and courses at other Stanford schools.
Take advantage of the resources, courses, and activities offered in our world-class Center for Social Innovation and Center for Entrepreneurial Studies
At Stanford, you’re supported. Our specialized network of advisors, fellows, and coaches understand the decisions you face and how to navigate them. We’ll help you craft your study plan and career goals while you hone your professional and interpersonal skills.
Every effort is made to ensure that the degree requirement and course information, applicable policies, and other materials provided by Stanford GSB are accurate and current. Stanford University reserves the right to make changes at any time without prior notice

Coursework mainly consists of core and distribution requirements. You’ll gain insights from world-class researchers and senior leaders and a deeper understanding of effective business management.
Students must complete a global experience requirement. This is an opportunity to engage with global issues and expand your mindset.
Second Year
Year two is about pursuing your path. Coursework entirely consists of electives. You’ll strengthen your areas of expertise, explore new subjects, and round out your general management education.
You can tailor your experience through an abundance of electives, seminars, a joint or dual degree, and courses at other Stanford schools.
World-Class Centers
Take advantage of the resources, courses, and activities offered in our world-class Center for Social Innovation and Center for Entrepreneurial Studies
Social Innovation 














Entrepreneurship
Social Innovation 














Entrepreneurship
Social Innovation 














Entrepreneurship
Social Innovation
Entrepreneurship
Support to Stay On Track
At Stanford, you’re supported. Our specialized network of advisors, fellows, and coaches understand the decisions you face and how to navigate them. We’ll help you craft your study plan and career goals while you hone your professional and interpersonal skills.








Every effort is made to ensure that the degree requirement and course information, applicable policies, and other materials provided by Stanford GSB are accurate and current. Stanford University reserves the right to make changes at any time without prior notice

pages.content:
[HEADING] MBA Admissions Events
[HEADING] MBA Information Sessions
[HEADING] Meet an MBA Admissions Officer
[HEADING] MBA Campus Visit Day
[HEADING] Online Events
[HEADING] Meet an MBA Student or Meet an MBA Alum
[HEADING] Worldwide Events
[HEADING] Community Events
[HEADING] See Yourself Here
[HEADING] Transportation & Accessibility
Connect with our community and learn more.
We offer many opportunities to engage with students, alumni, and admissions staff online, on campus, or in cities around the world. If you are thinking about applying, we welcome you to attend an admissions event, though a visit to campus is not required or expected.
Whether you are exploring business school for the first time or are ready to apply, find upcoming events in our schedule that meet your needs. Explore your interests and specific topics with our recorded events; your journey, your Stanford, your questions, and your application.
Hosted online and in person, information sessions are opportunities for you to get a detailed overview of the Stanford MBA Program’s distinctive features and admissions process, as well as get your questions answered. Advance registration is required.
These 45-minute small group events are hosted by Stanford MBA admissions officers. You have the opportunity to meet online or in person in an informal group setting. The focus of these sessions is on the application and admissions process, as well as any general questions about the Stanford MBA Program and experience. Advance registration is required.
Spend a day on campus with us –– observe a live MBA class, chat with students, and tour the GSB with an admissions officer. Campus Visit Days are held most Mondays and Fridays during the academic year, from October to May. Registration is required and space is limited. Class visit assignments are allocated on the day of the event, and to optimize visitor experience, we present a diverse range of classes that highlight the MBA curriculum. We do our best to accommodate individual preferences when capacity and demand allow. These events are scheduled a few weeks in advance and fill up quickly. You may sign up for only one Campus Visit Day per quarter.
While you are welcome to visit us, we know that not everyone can. We frequently offer admissions events online, including information sessions, regional and industry panels, MBA student experience panels, application workshops, and small group chats. We invite you to view our recorded events. Be sure to check our admissions event calendar for upcoming events and sign up to be notified when new events are scheduled.
These 45-minute small group events are hosted by students and alumni. You have the opportunity to meet online or in person in an informal group setting and ask your questions about Stanford GSB. The focus of these sessions is on the immersive living and learning experience, not the admissions process. Advance registration is required.
We hold dozens of admissions events throughout the world. We would love to see you while we are on the road! Learn more about Stanford’s MBA Program at a location near you, via:
Check out our event calendar regularly and stay in touch to receive personalized invitations and information.
Stanford GSB is a diverse community where people learn from — and teach — each other.
Each MBA class is diverse in the broadest possible terms, including educational and professional background, personal experience, goals, culture, interest and aspiration, socioeconomic status, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, and nationality.
We offer events throughout the year that address the perspectives and experiences of specific audiences. Everyone is welcome to attend.
We do not arrange or provide transportation to and from events, reimburse travel costs, or sponsor visas for international travel.
If you need a disability-related accommodation for one of our events, be sure to contact us at least one week before the event

MBA Admissions Events










Connect with our community and learn more.
We offer many opportunities to engage with students, alumni, and admissions staff online, on campus, or in cities around the world. If you are thinking about applying, we welcome you to attend an admissions event, though a visit to campus is not required or expected.
Whether you are exploring business school for the first time or are ready to apply, find upcoming events in our schedule that meet your needs. Explore your interests and specific topics with our recorded events; your journey, your Stanford, your questions, and your application.

























MBA Information Sessions



Hosted online and in person, information sessions are opportunities for you to get a detailed overview of the Stanford MBA Program’s distinctive features and admissions process, as well as get your questions answered. Advance registration is required.





Meet an MBA Admissions Officer



These 45-minute small group events are hosted by Stanford MBA admissions officers. You have the opportunity to meet online or in person in an informal group setting. The focus of these sessions is on the application and admissions process, as well as any general questions about the Stanford MBA Program and experience. Advance registration is required.





MBA Campus Visit Day



Spend a day on campus with us –– observe a live MBA class, chat with students, and tour the GSB with an admissions officer. Campus Visit Days are held most Mondays and Fridays during the academic year, from October to May. Registration is required and space is limited. Class visit assignments are allocated on the day of the event, and to optimize visitor experience, we present a diverse range of classes that highlight the MBA curriculum. We do our best to accommodate individual preferences when capacity and demand allow. These events are scheduled a few weeks in advance and fill up quickly. You may sign up for only one Campus Visit Day per quarter.





Online Events



While you are welcome to visit us, we know that not everyone can. We frequently offer admissions events online, including information sessions, regional and industry panels, MBA student experience panels, application workshops, and small group chats. We invite you to view our recorded events. Be sure to check our admissions event calendar for upcoming events and sign up to be notified when new events are scheduled.





Meet an MBA Student or Meet an MBA Alum



These 45-minute small group events are hosted by students and alumni. You have the opportunity to meet online or in person in an informal group setting and ask your questions about Stanford GSB. The focus of these sessions is on the immersive living and learning experience, not the admissions process. Advance registration is required.





Worldwide Events



We hold dozens of admissions events throughout the world. We would love to see you while we are on the road! Learn more about Stanford’s MBA Program at a location near you, via:

Information sessions
College visits
MBA fairs
Informal chats with students, alumni, or admissions officers
Diversity and women’s information sessions

Check out our event calendar regularly and stay in touch to receive personalized invitations and information.





Community Events



Stanford GSB is a diverse community where people learn from — and teach — each other.
Each MBA class is diverse in the broadest possible terms, including educational and professional background, personal experience, goals, culture, interest and aspiration, socioeconomic status, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, and nationality.
We offer events throughout the year that address the perspectives and experiences of specific audiences. Everyone is welcome to attend.

These 45-minute small group events are hosted by Stanford MBA admissions officers. You have the opportunity to meet online or in person in an informal group setting. The focus of these sessions is on the application and admissions process, as well as any general questions about the Stanford MBA Program and experience. Advance registration is required.





MBA Campus Visit Day



Spend a day on campus with us –– observe a live MBA class, chat with students, and tour the GSB with an admissions officer. Campus Visit Days are held most Mondays and Fridays during the academic year, from October to May. Registration is required and space is limited. Class visit assignments are allocated on the day of the event, and to optimize visitor experience, we present a diverse range of classes that highlight the MBA curriculum. We do our best to accommodate individual preferences when capacity and demand allow. These events are scheduled a few weeks in advance and fill up quickly. You may sign up for only one Campus Visit Day per quarter.





Online Events



While you are welcome to visit us, we know that not everyone can. We frequently offer admissions events online, including information sessions, regional and industry panels, MBA student experience panels, application workshops, and small group chats. We invite you to view our recorded events. Be sure to check our admissions event calendar for upcoming events and sign up to be notified when new events are scheduled.





Meet an MBA Student or Meet an MBA Alum



These 45-minute small group events are hosted by students and alumni. You have the opportunity to meet online or in person in an informal group setting and ask your questions about Stanford GSB. The focus of these sessions is on the immersive living and learning experience, not the admissions process. Advance registration is required.





Worldwide Events



We hold dozens of admissions events throughout the world. We would love to see you while we are on the road! Learn more about Stanford’s MBA Program at a location near you, via:

Information sessions
College visits
MBA fairs
Informal chats with students, alumni, or admissions officers
Diversity and women’s information sessions

Check out our event calendar regularly and stay in touch to receive personalized invitations and information.





Community Events



Stanford GSB is a diverse community where people learn from — and teach — each other.
Each MBA class is diverse in the broadest possible terms, including educational and professional background, personal experience, goals, culture, interest and aspiration, socioeconomic status, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, and nationality.
We offer events throughout the year that address the perspectives and experiences of specific audiences. Everyone is welcome to attend.

pages.title: MBA Admissions Events | Stanford Graduate School of Business

pages.content:
[HEADING] Reapplication
[HEADING] If You Reapply
[HEADING] Advice on Reapplying
Admission to the Stanford MBA Program is very competitive, and we cannot offer seats in the class to as many applicants as we would like. If you are not offered admission, you are welcome to apply again in a future application year.
Having applied in a previous year is not a negative factor in your application. We appreciate your sustained interest in Stanford and your commitment to reapplying. In fact, every year we offer admission to reapplicants who present compelling applications.
Because the application changes each year, you must complete a new application in the year for which you apply. Some biographical information from your previous application will carry over to your new one, although you will be able to edit all fields in your new application. You will also be required to pay the application fee unless you qualify for a fee reduction or fee waiver.
As long as your test scores (GMAT or GRE for general academic aptitude and TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE for English language proficiency) remain valid for the round in which you wish to apply, you do not need to retake them or have them re-sent by the test centers. If your test scores are no longer valid, you need to retake the exams.
We will evaluate your new application on its merits in the context of the new applicant pool. It is likely that the person reviewing your application has not seen your previous one. We do have access to previous applications, however, and may choose whether to review and consider them before making a final decision.

Reapplication










Admission to the Stanford MBA Program is very competitive, and we cannot offer seats in the class to as many applicants as we would like. If you are not offered admission, you are welcome to apply again in a future application year.
Having applied in a previous year is not a negative factor in your application. We appreciate your sustained interest in Stanford and your commitment to reapplying. In fact, every year we offer admission to reapplicants who present compelling applications.
If You Reapply
Because the application changes each year, you must complete a new application in the year for which you apply. Some biographical information from your previous application will carry over to your new one, although you will be able to edit all fields in your new application. You will also be required to pay the application fee unless you qualify for a fee reduction or fee waiver.
As long as your test scores (GMAT or GRE for general academic aptitude and TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE for English language proficiency) remain valid for the round in which you wish to apply, you do not need to retake them or have them re-sent by the test centers. If your test scores are no longer valid, you need to retake the exams.
We will evaluate your new application on its merits in the context of the new applicant pool. It is likely that the person reviewing your application has not seen your previous one. We do have access to previous applications, however, and may choose whether to review and consider them before making a final decision.






Advice on Reapplying

We cannot provide feedback on denied applications.
Approach your application with a fresh outlook. We will!
If you choose the same recommenders (and that’s up to you!), make sure they submit a current letter.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Application Fee
[HEADING] Reduced Fee for Defer-Eligible Applicants
[HEADING] Military Service Fee Waiver
[HEADING] Sí Se Puede Latin America Fee Waiver
[HEADING] Need-Based Fee Waiver
[HEADING] Application Fee Payment Method
The Stanford MBA Program application fee is $275 and is nonrefundable.
We recognize that, for some, this application fee may be a barrier to apply. To reduce the financial burden, we offer the following application fee waivers and fee reductions:
If you are in your final year of a bachelor’s degree or a joint bachelor/graduate program (and your degree will be conferred between 01 October 2025 and 30 September 2026) or you are currently enrolled in a graduate program (which you began immediately following an undergraduate or undergraduate/graduate program), you qualify for a reduced application fee of $100.
The application fee is waived for active-duty U.S. military service members, U.S. military veterans who have been honorably discharged, and those serving in the U.S. military reserves. If you are eligible for a waiver, upload one of the following documents when prompted in the online application:
Alternatively, you may submit other documentation, but it must indicate your current military status and the date you will be separating from that status. (Do not submit a copy of your military ID.)
If you are from Latin America (including Puerto Rico and the Caribbean islands, Central America, Mexico, and South America, including Brazil) — and you make less than US $40,000 per year — your MBA application fee will automatically be waived in the 2025–2026 application year when you submit your application. The salary currency conversion to U.S. dollars will be calculated based on exchange rates on 16 June 2025.
If paying the application fee poses an extreme financial hardship, you may apply for a need-based fee waiver. You must complete the items below in your admissions application before requesting a waiver:
Once you have finished these steps in your application, you must submit an additional form and supporting documentation. Contact admissions-mba@stanford.edu for further instructions. All materials are due by 29 August 2025. We will not consider any Round 1 fee waiver requests after this date. Waivers are offered on a first come, first served basis.
The MBA Admissions Office will evaluate your application and release your decision only after you have paid the application fee (as applicable). We must receive your fee by 4:00 p.m. Pacific Time on the deadline date for the round in which you are applying.
You can pay the application fee by debit card (with a Visa or Mastercard logo) or by credit card while in the online application. We accept American Express, Discover, Mastercard, and Visa.

Application Fee










The Stanford MBA Program application fee is $275 and is nonrefundable.
We recognize that, for some, this application fee may be a barrier to apply. To reduce the financial burden, we offer the following application fee waivers and fee reductions:







Reduced Fee for Defer-Eligible Applicants



If you are in your final year of a bachelor’s degree or a joint bachelor/graduate program (and your degree will be conferred between 01 October 2025 and 30 September 2026) or you are currently enrolled in a graduate program (which you began immediately following an undergraduate or undergraduate/graduate program), you qualify for a reduced application fee of $100.





Military Service Fee Waiver



The application fee is waived for active-duty U.S. military service members, U.S. military veterans who have been honorably discharged, and those serving in the U.S. military reserves. If you are eligible for a waiver, upload one of the following documents when prompted in the online application:

Option 1: Proof-of-service statement or letter, dated within the last 45 days
Option 2: Copy of most recent enlistment contract, dated within the last 365 days
Option 3: Copy of Tuition Assistance (TA) form showing date of separation (if applicable)
Option 4: Copy of your most recent leave and earnings statements showing estimated time of separation, dated within the last 45 days

Alternatively, you may submit other documentation, but it must indicate your current military status and the date you will be separating from that status. (Do not submit a copy of your military ID.)





Sí Se Puede Latin America Fee Waiver



If you are from Latin America (including Puerto Rico and the Caribbean islands, Central America, Mexico, and South America, including Brazil) — and you make less than US $40,000 per year — your MBA application fee will automatically be waived in the 2025–2026 application year when you submit your application. The salary currency conversion to U.S. dollars will be calculated based on exchange rates on 16 June 2025.





Need-Based Fee Waiver



If paying the application fee poses an extreme financial hardship, you may apply for a need-based fee waiver. You must complete the items below in your admissions application before requesting a waiver:

Hold a U.S. bachelor’s degree or international equivalent

Only under rare circumstances will we consider exceptions to this policy


Take the required test(s) or have proof of scheduled testing before the round deadline:

GMAT or GRE
English language proficiency test, if applicable


Start an MBA application for direct admission (defer-eligible applicants qualify for a reduced fee)
Enter your primary citizenship
Add your current job and employer information in Professional Experience 
Upload a current resume

Once you have finished these steps in your application, you must submit an additional form and supporting documentation. Contact admissions-mba@stanford.edu for further instructions. All materials are due by 29 August 2025. We will not consider any Round 1 fee waiver requests after this date. Waivers are offered on a first come, first served basis.
 









  Application Fee Payment Method
The MBA Admissions Office will evaluate your application and release your decision only after you have paid the application fee (as applicable). We must receive your fee by 4:00 p.m. Pacific Time on the deadline date for the round in which you are applying.
You can pay the application fee by debit card (with a Visa or Mastercard logo) or by credit card while in the online application. We accept American Express, Discover, Mastercard, and Visa.

Need-Based Fee Waiver



If paying the application fee poses an extreme financial hardship, you may apply for a need-based fee waiver. You must complete the items below in your admissions application before requesting a waiver:

Hold a U.S. bachelor’s degree or international equivalent

Only under rare circumstances will we consider exceptions to this policy


Take the required test(s) or have proof of scheduled testing before the round deadline:

GMAT or GRE
English language proficiency test, if applicable


Start an MBA application for direct admission (defer-eligible applicants qualify for a reduced fee)
Enter your primary citizenship
Add your current job and employer information in Professional Experience 
Upload a current resume

Once you have finished these steps in your application, you must submit an additional form and supporting documentation. Contact admissions-mba@stanford.edu for further instructions. All materials are due by 29 August 2025. We will not consider any Round 1 fee waiver requests after this date. Waivers are offered on a first come, first served basis.
Application Fee Payment Method
The MBA Admissions Office will evaluate your application and release your decision only after you have paid the application fee (as applicable). We must receive your fee by 4:00 p.m. Pacific Time on the deadline date for the round in which you are applying.
You can pay the application fee by debit card (with a Visa or Mastercard logo) or by credit card while in the online application. We accept American Express, Discover, Mastercard, and Visa.

Applying to the MBA Program










Whether you’re curious to take a quick peek at the application or ready to dive in, you can access the Stanford MBA application portal anytime.










Start or Update Your Application 










  Learn About the Application
In this section, you will find helpful information to complete your online application. More detailed instructions can be found in the application itself.










 



Education



Describe your educational journey to date.







 



Test Scores



We require either the GMAT or GRE and, if applicable, an English language proficiency test.







 



Personal Information, Activities, and Awards



Tell us about yourself and your interests.







 



Professional Experience



In addition to your resume, help us understand your professional history.







 



Letters of Recommendation



We require two letters of recommendation, preferably from individuals who have supervised your work.







 



Essays



We want to get to know you and learn why you are interested in us.







 



Optional Short Answer Question



An opportunity to share more deeply about your contributions.







 



Application Fee



The MBA program application fee is $275 — we offer fee waivers for certain circumstances.







 



Reapplication



What you need to know when reapplying to the Stanford MBA Program.





















Discover What We Look For in an Applicant 














Application Best Practices



Supplemental Application Information



If there is any information that is critical for us to know and is not captured elsewhere, include it in the Additional Information section of the application. Pertinent examples include:

Extenuating circumstances affecting your candidacy, including academic, work, or test-taking experiences
Academic experience (e.g., independent research) not noted elsewhere

This section should not be used as an additional essay.
Do not email or mail supplemental application materials to our office, such as video links, photos, etc. We will not review these items or follow any links you provide in your application.
If you need to correspond with the MBA Admissions Office about your application, you must email us from the email address that is associated with your online application.
If any important and relevant information has changed since you submitted your application, you may log in to your application status portal and provide the information in the Upload Materials section. However, we cannot guarantee that information submitted after the deadline will be reviewed.





Email Filters



Adjust your junk/spam email filters to accept all emails from:

@stanford.edu.






Acceptable Operating Systems




Mac OS X 10.6+
Windows 7, 8, 10, 11






Acceptable Browsers




With the exception of Internet Explorer, all browsers with versions less than a year old are acceptable
All versions of Internet Explorer are not compatible

Disable pop-up blockers

Professional Experience



In addition to your resume, help us understand your professional history.
Letters of Recommendation



We require two letters of recommendation, preferably from individuals who have supervised your work.
Essays



We want to get to know you and learn why you are interested in us.

An opportunity to share more deeply about your contributions.

Application Best Practices



Supplemental Application Information



If there is any information that is critical for us to know and is not captured elsewhere, include it in the Additional Information section of the application. Pertinent examples include:

Extenuating circumstances affecting your candidacy, including academic, work, or test-taking experiences
Academic experience (e.g., independent research) not noted elsewhere

This section should not be used as an additional essay.
Do not email or mail supplemental application materials to our office, such as video links, photos, etc. We will not review these items or follow any links you provide in your application.
If you need to correspond with the MBA Admissions Office about your application, you must email us from the email address that is associated with your online application.
If any important and relevant information has changed since you submitted your application, you may log in to your application status portal and provide the information in the Upload Materials section. However, we cannot guarantee that information submitted after the deadline will be reviewed.





Email Filters



Adjust your junk/spam email filters to accept all emails from:

@stanford.edu.

Windows 7, 8, 10, 11

All versions of Internet Explorer are not compatible

pages.title: Applying to the MBA Program | Stanford Graduate School of Business

pages.content:
[HEADING] Deadlines for Applying to the MBA Program
[HEADING] Selecting an Application Round
[HEADING] Decision Notification
[HEADING] Deferral Policy
Your completed application, including your letters of recommendation and application fee payment, is due at 4:00 p.m. Pacific Time on the deadline date for the round in which you apply.
We cannot guarantee that we will review information sent to the MBA Admissions Office after the deadline of the round in which you apply.
You may apply once per application year in any one of the three application rounds.
Do not rush your application, but there are some advantages to applying in either Round 1 or Round 2, including:
If you and your partner are both applying in the same year, we strongly encourage you to apply in the same round so that you will know if your partner has been admitted by the time you have to accept or decline your offer of admission.
If you are interested in deferred enrollment, you may apply in any round.
We will post your decision to your account on the notification date above for the round in which you applied. We will also send an email to the address used to create your application profile to notify you when your decision is available.
We do not accommodate requests for an early decision or for decision information to be provided via phone or in person.
If you are offered admission, you will be expected to enroll in the MBA or dual/joint-degree program in the year for which you are admitted unless you meet the criteria for deferred enrollment. If you do not meet these criteria, we do not allow you to defer admission to a later year. Instead, we ask you to reapply. Only under rare and extraordinary circumstances (e.g., compulsory military service) will we consider exceptions to this policy.

If you do not meet these criteria, we do not allow you to defer admission to a later year. Instead, we ask you to reapply. Only under rare and extraordinary circumstances (e.g., compulsory military service) will we consider exceptions to this policy.


















Stay in Touch 

















Attend an Event 

















Apply
Your completed application, including your letters of recommendation and application fee payment, is due at 4:00 p.m. Pacific Time on the deadline date for the round in which you apply.
We cannot guarantee that we will review information sent to the MBA Admissions Office after the deadline of the round in which you apply.
2025–26 Deadlines

Round 3
07 Apr 2026
28 May 2026
Selecting an Application Round
You may apply once per application year in any one of the three application rounds.
Do not rush your application, but there are some advantages to applying in either Round 1 or Round 2, including:








If you and your partner are both applying in the same year, we strongly encourage you to apply in the same round so that you will know if your partner has been admitted by the time you have to accept or decline your offer of admission.
If you are interested in deferred enrollment, you may apply in any round.
Decision Notification
We will post your decision to your account on the notification date above for the round in which you applied. We will also send an email to the address used to create your application profile to notify you when your decision is available.
We do not accommodate requests for an early decision or for decision information to be provided via phone or in person.
Deferral Policy
If you are offered admission, you will be expected to enroll in the MBA or dual/joint-degree program in the year for which you are admitted unless you meet the criteria for deferred enrollment. If you do not meet these criteria, we do not allow you to defer admission to a later year. Instead, we ask you to reapply. Only under rare and extraordinary circumstances (e.g., compulsory military service) will we consider exceptions to this policy.

pages.title: Deadlines for Applying to the MBA Program | Stanford Graduate School of Business

pages.content:
[HEADING] Admission to the Stanford MBA Program
[HEADING] Personalizing Your Admission Journey
[HEADING] Applying to the Stanford MBA Program
[HEADING] Connecting with Us
[HEADING] Upcoming Events
[HEADING] Tuesday, Aug 05, 2025
[HEADING] Thursday, Aug 07, 2025
[HEADING] Saturday, Aug 09, 2025
[HEADING] Take a Look Around Campus
[HEADING] Reporting Accessibility Issues
Your story starts here. But before the late-night study sessions, before your global experience, before you can get your MBA, you need to apply.
Take a look at our entering MBA class. At Stanford GSB, you’ll find yourself surrounded by smart, driven people from all over the world aspiring to make a difference. Your colleagues will push you in ways you could never do on your own. Stanford’s culture of collaboration creates an environment unlike any other in which students learn, lead, and grow with each other. In that collaborative spirit, hear what a few students have to say about applying:
Create or update your MBA Profile! Head to MyStanfordGSB.Info to see a personalized dashboard for your MBA journey. The MyStanfordGSB prospect portal helps you track your application progress, register for upcoming events, and engage with stories and content relevant to you.
The big question on every applicant’s mind is: What is Stanford GSB looking for?
We won’t give you a checklist to mark off, because there isn’t one. There is no typical Stanford MBA student, no ideal for applicants to chase. Our advice is to just focus on you and ensure that your application is a true reflection of yourself.
That being said, we do look at some general evaluation criteria: how you think, how you lead, and how you see the world. The way you express those qualities should be authentically your own.
As you work through your application, our admissions office is more than happy to answer any questions after you read through this information.
Learn from students, alumni, and staff just what makes Stanford GSB so special to them. Virtual and in-person admissions events will fill in the details about how Stanford can transform your life and career. Admissions events include MBA information sessions, regional and industry panels, small group chats, class visits, campus tours, and other chances to engage with students, alumni, and admissions staff around the world.
Join your student guides on an interactive tour of the Stanford GSB campus.
We want everyone to have access to our website. If you are unable to access content or use features of this website due to a disability, please report the issue by submitting a HelpSU ticket or contact the Stanford Online Accessibility Program.

Learn More about the MBA Program

Your story starts here. But before the late-night study sessions, before your global experience, before you can get your MBA, you need to apply.
Take a look at our entering MBA class. At Stanford GSB, you’ll find yourself surrounded by smart, driven people from all over the world aspiring to make a difference. Your colleagues will push you in ways you could never do on your own. Stanford’s culture of collaboration creates an environment unlike any other in which students learn, lead, and grow with each other. In that collaborative spirit, hear what a few students have to say about applying:



















Start Your Application Now 





Learn More about the MBA Program 














  Personalizing Your Admission Journey
Create or update your MBA Profile! Head to MyStanfordGSB.Info to see a personalized dashboard for your MBA journey. The MyStanfordGSB prospect portal helps you track your application progress, register for upcoming events, and engage with stories and content relevant to you.














Go to MyStanfordGSB 













  Applying to the Stanford MBA Program 
The big question on every applicant’s mind is: What is Stanford GSB looking for?
We won’t give you a checklist to mark off, because there isn’t one. There is no typical Stanford MBA student, no ideal for applicants to chase. Our advice is to just focus on you and ensure that your application is a true reflection of yourself.
That being said, we do look at some general evaluation criteria: how you think, how you lead, and how you see the world. The way you express those qualities should be authentically your own.
As you work through your application, our admissions office is more than happy to answer any questions after you read through this information.







  Connecting with Us
Learn from students, alumni, and staff just what makes Stanford GSB so special to them. Virtual and in-person admissions events will fill in the details about how Stanford can transform your life and career. Admissions events include MBA information sessions, regional and industry panels, small group chats, class visits, campus tours, and other chances to engage with students, alumni, and admissions staff around the world.

pages.title: Admission to the Stanford MBA Program Information for the Stanford MBA Program | Stanford Graduate School of Business

pages.content:
[HEADING] Application Process
[HEADING] Required Application Materials
[HEADING] Free Application for Federal Student Aid
[HEADING] Institutional Application
[HEADING] Tax Returns or Statements
[HEADING] Financial Need
[HEADING] Consumer Debt
[HEADING] Educational Loans
Once you are admitted to Stanford GSB, we will provide you with all the information and guidance you need to apply for financial aid.
You will renew your financial aid application each year you are enrolled.
All U.S. citizens or permanent resident aid applicants must complete the FAFSA. There is no processing fee and the FAFSA is required for all federal student aid eligibility. The FAFSA will ask you to report the prior, prior year’s tax information.
All admitted students who want to be considered for a Stanford GSB fellowship and/or loans must complete the institutional application. You are expected to provide information for yourself and, if applicable, your spouse. There is no processing fee.
If you are a U.S. citizen or permanent resident, you will provide signed copies of your completed U.S. federal tax returns for the prior two years to the financial aid office, including copies of all schedules and copies of your W-2 forms. If applicable, you will submit copies of your spouse’s information as well.
If you are an international student, provide copies of your tax statements for the last two years from all countries in which you worked, including wage statements, to the financial aid office.
More details about submitting your tax forms will be provided once you are admitted to Stanford GSB.
Once you’ve completed the required forms, we determine your financial need and the amount of aid we can offer. The Stanford GSB Financial Aid Office defines “need” as:
You may be notified by our office to submit additional forms in order to complete the financial aid application process.
Federal law specifically states that we cannot include consumer debts (e.g., credit cards, consumer loans, car loans) in the student budget. Therefore, we are unable to increase your cost of attendance to demonstrate additional financial aid eligibility to assist you in making payments for such debt. Moreover, we will not be able to decrease the value of your assets by the amount of consumer debt.
While most U.S. government educational loans have deferment options for students enrolled at least half time in an educational program, some educational loans may not. We cannot take these loans into consideration while determining your fellowship eligibility.

Application Process










Once you are admitted to Stanford GSB, we will provide you with all the information and guidance you need to apply for financial aid.
You will renew your financial aid application each year you are enrolled.







  Required Application Materials



Student
Materials to Submit


US Citizen or Permanent Resident


Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Institutional application
Federal tax returns from two prior years, including all forms, schedules,
				W-2s, and confirmation of tax filing status
Most recent pay stub




International


Institutional application
Most recent tax statements for the last two years from all countries in which you worked, including wage statements
Most recent pay stub





Free Application for Federal Student Aid
All U.S. citizens or permanent resident aid applicants must complete the FAFSA. There is no processing fee and the FAFSA is required for all federal student aid eligibility. The FAFSA will ask you to report the prior, prior year’s tax information.
Institutional Application
All admitted students who want to be considered for a Stanford GSB fellowship and/or loans must complete the institutional application. You are expected to provide information for yourself and, if applicable, your spouse. There is no processing fee.
Tax Returns or Statements
If you are a U.S. citizen or permanent resident, you will provide signed copies of your completed U.S. federal tax returns for the prior two years to the financial aid office, including copies of all schedules and copies of your W-2 forms. If applicable, you will submit copies of your spouse’s information as well.
If you are an international student, provide copies of your tax statements for the last two years from all countries in which you worked, including wage statements, to the financial aid office.
More details about submitting your tax forms will be provided once you are admitted to Stanford GSB.







  Financial Need
Once you’ve completed the required forms, we determine your financial need and the amount of aid we can offer. The Stanford GSB Financial Aid Office defines “need” as:

















You may be notified by our office to submit additional forms in order to complete the financial aid application process.
































  Consumer Debt


Federal law specifically states that we cannot include consumer debts (e.g., credit cards, consumer loans, car loans) in the student budget. Therefore, we are unable to increase your cost of attendance to demonstrate additional financial aid eligibility to assist you in making payments for such debt. Moreover, we will not be able to decrease the value of your assets by the amount of consumer debt.


Show More 








  Educational Loans


While most U.S. government educational loans have deferment options for students enrolled at least half time in an educational program, some educational loans may not. We cannot take these loans into consideration while determining your fellowship eligibility.


Show More 
















Learn About the Types of Aid Available to You

Federal law specifically states that we cannot include consumer debts (e.g., credit cards, consumer loans, car loans) in the student budget. Therefore, we are unable to increase your cost of attendance to demonstrate additional financial aid eligibility to assist you in making payments for such debt. Moreover, we will not be able to decrease the value of your assets by the amount of consumer debt.
[CARD]
Educational Loans
Educational Loans


While most U.S. government educational loans have deferment options for students enrolled at least half time in an educational program, some educational loans may not. We cannot take these loans into consideration while determining your fellowship eligibility.


Show More

Stanford GSB will match up to full tuition and mandatory fees (minus Stanford medical insurance*) for MBA students who are Yellow Ribbon-eligible and opt to receive these benefits. These students will not be eligible to receive additional need-based fellowships but are eligible for student loans if needed. All other MBA veteran students who are not eligible for Yellow Ribbon or vocational rehabilitation are encouraged to apply for need-based fellowships to help supplement their VA benefits.
Eligibility criteria require that you fall into one of these categories:
The Office for Military-Affiliated Communities serves as the liaison between the university, its students, and the various federal, state, and local agencies concerned with veterans’ benefits. Review the website for additional information about education benefits for veterans at Stanford.
*Yellow Ribbon match does not cover medical insurance since veterans have primary coverage through the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.

[GRID_TABLE]
Yellow Ribbon Program










Stanford GSB participates in the Post-9/11 Veterans Education Assistance Act of 2008, the Yellow Ribbon Program, a grant that is available to eligible military candidates.
Stanford GSB will match up to full tuition and mandatory fees (minus Stanford medical insurance*) for MBA students who are Yellow Ribbon-eligible and opt to receive these benefits. These students will not be eligible to receive additional need-based fellowships but are eligible for student loans if needed. All other MBA veteran students who are not eligible for Yellow Ribbon or vocational rehabilitation are encouraged to apply for need-based fellowships to help supplement their VA benefits.
Eligibility criteria require that you fall into one of these categories:

Served an aggregate period of active duty of at least 36 months after September 10, 2001
Were honorably discharged from active duty for a service-connected disability and you served at least 30 continuous days after September 10, 2001
Are a dependent eligible for Transfer of Entitlement under the Post-9/11 GI Bill based on veteran’s service under the eligibility criteria listed above

The Office for Military-Affiliated Communities serves as the liaison between the university, its students, and the various federal, state, and local agencies concerned with veterans’ benefits. Review the website for additional information about education benefits for veterans at Stanford.
*Yellow Ribbon match does not cover medical insurance since veterans have primary coverage through the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.

pages.title: Yellow Ribbon Program | Stanford Graduate School of Business

pages.content:
[HEADING] Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program
[HEADING] Katherine Tang
[HEADING] From Our Students
[HEADING] Wasan Kumar
[HEADING] Kelly McFarlane
[HEADING] Bryce Marion
The Knight-Hennessy Scholars program is designed to build a multidisciplinary community of Stanford graduate students dedicated to finding creative solutions to the world’s greatest challenges.
As a Knight-Hennessy Scholar, you will develop a deep academic foundation and the broad skill set to develop creative solutions to effect positive change in the world. You will be part of a unique community of change agents from a diverse range of backgrounds.
"I am profoundly grateful to be a part of the Knight-Hennessy community, a fantastic complement to GSB. With scholars spanning across Stanford's graduate programs — all of whom are kind, bright, and inspiring — we have an unparalleled opportunity to stretch interdisciplinary thinking and global mindedness, essential ingredients to tackle the biggest challenges our world faces today. Knight-Hennessy is a place where I expect to grow as a leader for decades to come."
The Knight-Hennessy Scholars program is the largest fully endowed scholars program in the world. The program awards high-achieving students every year with full funding to pursue any graduate degree at Stanford, including joint and dual degrees. To be considered, you must apply separately to the Knight-Hennessy Scholars program and to your Stanford GSB graduate degree program (by Round 1).
"I am thrilled to be a part of the Knight-Hennessy community during my time at the GSB. Through this program, I have had the chance to meet exceptional scholars in a wide variety of fields and join seminars on topics that opened my mind to new possibilities. The GSB experience and Knight-Hennessy community push me to think deeply about my values and leadership style, and importantly have helped me build friendships that I will carry lifelong."
“I am fortunate to have the incredible opportunity to work with and learn from remarkable classmates, professors, and leaders on a daily basis. In addition to the amazing MBA community, the Knight-Hennessy program fosters an interdisciplinary network of diverse individuals from across Stanford graduate schools, many of whom I likely would not have had the chance to meet otherwise. Both the Knight-Hennessy program and the GSB have challenged me to think differently, push boundaries, and leave my comfort zone in pursuit of my passions to change the world around us for the better.”
“The Knight-Hennessy community has been a powerful catalyst for creativity and connection—through it, I’ve honed a storytelling skillset that transcends disciplines and embraced the opportunity to act as a node across campus, connecting people around shared interests and ideas. From curiosity-driven seminars to retreats that stretch the emotional core, Knight-Hennessy has expanded my sense of purpose and deepened the friendships that define my Stanford journey.”

Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program










The Knight-Hennessy Scholars program is designed to build a multidisciplinary community of Stanford graduate students dedicated to finding creative solutions to the world’s greatest challenges.
As a Knight-Hennessy Scholar, you will develop a deep academic foundation and the broad skill set to develop creative solutions to effect positive change in the world. You will be part of a unique community of change agents from a diverse range of backgrounds.










Student Spotlight



  Katherine Tang

MBA 2026

"I am profoundly grateful to be a part of the Knight-Hennessy community, a fantastic complement to GSB. With scholars spanning across Stanford's graduate programs — all of whom are kind, bright, and inspiring — we have an unparalleled opportunity to stretch interdisciplinary thinking and global mindedness, essential ingredients to tackle the biggest challenges our world faces today. Knight-Hennessy is a place where I expect to grow as a leader for decades to come." 


Show More 






The Knight-Hennessy Scholars program is the largest fully endowed scholars program in the world. The program awards high-achieving students every year with full funding to pursue any graduate degree at Stanford, including joint and dual degrees. To be considered, you must apply separately to the Knight-Hennessy Scholars program and to your Stanford GSB graduate degree program (by Round 1).






From Our Students









  Wasan Kumar

MBA, MD 2025

"I am thrilled to be a part of the Knight-Hennessy community during my time at the GSB. Through this program, I have had the chance to meet exceptional scholars in a wide variety of fields and join seminars on topics that opened my mind to new possibilities. The GSB experience and Knight-Hennessy community push me to think deeply about my values and leadership style, and importantly have helped me build friendships that I will carry lifelong."


Show More 











  Kelly McFarlane

MBA 2021

“I am fortunate to have the incredible opportunity to work with and learn from remarkable classmates, professors, and leaders on a daily basis. In addition to the amazing MBA community, the Knight-Hennessy program fosters an interdisciplinary network of diverse individuals from across Stanford graduate schools, many of whom I likely would not have had the chance to meet otherwise. Both the Knight-Hennessy program and the GSB have challenged me to think differently, push boundaries, and leave my comfort zone in pursuit of my passions to change the world around us for the better.”


Show More 











  Bryce Marion

MBA 2025

“The Knight-Hennessy community has been a powerful catalyst for creativity and connection—through it, I’ve honed a storytelling skillset that transcends disciplines and embraced the opportunity to act as a node across campus, connecting people around shared interests and ideas. From curiosity-driven seminars to retreats that stretch the emotional core, Knight-Hennessy has expanded my sense of purpose and deepened the friendships that define my Stanford journey.”


Show More

The GSB experience and Knight-Hennessy community push me to think deeply about my values and leadership style, and importantly have helped me build friendships that I will carry lifelong."


Show More
Kelly McFarlane

MBA 2021

“I am fortunate to have the incredible opportunity to work with and learn from remarkable classmates, professors, and leaders on a daily basis. In addition to the amazing MBA community, the Knight-Hennessy program fosters an interdisciplinary network of diverse individuals from across Stanford graduate schools, many of whom I likely would not have had the chance to meet otherwise. Both the Knight-Hennessy program and the GSB have challenged me to think differently, push boundaries, and leave my comfort zone in pursuit of my passions to change the world around us for the better.”


Show More
Bryce Marion

MBA 2025

“The Knight-Hennessy community has been a powerful catalyst for creativity and connection—through it, I’ve honed a storytelling skillset that transcends disciplines and embraced the opportunity to act as a node across campus, connecting people around shared interests and ideas. From curiosity-driven seminars to retreats that stretch the emotional core, Knight-Hennessy has expanded my sense of purpose and deepened the friendships that define my Stanford journey.”

pages.title: Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program | Stanford Graduate School of Business

pages.content:
[HEADING] Tuition and Financial Aid
[HEADING] Need-Based Aid
[HEADING] Your Financial Contribution
[HEADING] Affording Business School
[HEADING] We’re Here to Help
A Stanford MBA degree is a significant investment in you and your future. Our community is committed to providing you the opportunity to attend Stanford GSB regardless of your financial resources.
Stanford GSB can help you fund your MBA through a combination of student loans and generous fellowship awards. Fellowships are offered to those with demonstrated need.
All MBA students who have demonstrated need, regardless of citizenship, are eligible for financial aid. Fellowships are gifts from our community, and they do not have to be repaid. The average Stanford GSB fellowship for the class of 2025 was approximately $50,000 per year or $100,000 in total awards.
Stanford MBA Program admission is need-blind. We do not consider your personal resources for financing your education in our admission decisions.
In the admissions process, we seek to learn about how you think, how you lead, and how you see the world. These admission decisions do not consider how you will finance your MBA degree — they are made before you submit a financial aid application.
Once you have been admitted, we calculate an expected student contribution based on your particular financial situation. We provide aid to U.S. citizens and permanent residents as well as to international students who have demonstrated need.
All students are expected to contribute a portion of their income and assets to funding their Stanford MBA. Students are encouraged to repay consumer debt before applying for financial aid at Stanford GSB. The difference between the cost of attendance and the expected student contribution is then covered by a combination of fellowships and loans. Stanford GSB fellowships will be awarded based solely on your demonstrated financial need.
The financial aid office staff is available to answer questions about the application process and policies at any time. However, due to the large number of applications for admission to the Stanford MBA Program, the financial aid office reviews and awards financial aid to admitted students only.

Stanford GSB fellowships will be awarded based solely on your demonstrated financial need.









 
00:16:14




Affording Business School
Stanford GSB students share how they approached funding their MBA and their personal experiences navigating the financial aid process.









We’re Here to Help
The financial aid office staff is available to answer questions about the application process and policies at any time. However, due to the large number of applications for admission to the Stanford MBA Program, the financial aid office reviews and awards financial aid to admitted students only.
A Stanford MBA degree is a significant investment in you and your future. Our community is committed to providing you the opportunity to attend Stanford GSB regardless of your financial resources.
Stanford GSB can help you fund your MBA through a combination of student loans and generous fellowship awards. Fellowships are offered to those with demonstrated need.
All MBA students who have demonstrated need, regardless of citizenship, are eligible for financial aid. Fellowships are gifts from our community, and they do not have to be repaid. The average Stanford GSB fellowship for the class of 2025 was approximately $50,000 per year or $100,000 in total awards.
Need-Based Aid
Stanford MBA Program admission is need-blind. We do not consider your personal resources for financing your education in our admission decisions.
In the admissions process, we seek to learn about how you think, how you lead, and how you see the world. These admission decisions do not consider how you will finance your MBA degree — they are made before you submit a financial aid application.
Your Financial Contribution
Once you have been admitted, we calculate an expected student contribution based on your particular financial situation. We provide aid to U.S. citizens and permanent residents as well as to international students who have demonstrated need.
All students are expected to contribute a portion of their income and assets to funding their Stanford MBA. Students are encouraged to repay consumer debt before applying for financial aid at Stanford GSB. The difference between the cost of attendance and the expected student contribution is then covered by a combination of fellowships and loans. Stanford GSB fellowships will be awarded based solely on your demonstrated financial need.

[HEADING] Career Impact

[HEADING] Juan Rosenkrantz
[HEADING] Marcia Austin
[HEADING] Marcia Austin
Stanford GSB provides a transformational experience that will change your life and the lives of those around you.
We guide you on your journey toward a life of meaning and a career with impact, equipped with the ideas, skills, experiences, and supportive community you need to succeed.
Every student’s journey is unique, but no matter where you are headed, we’ll be the propelling platform to get you there. Maybe you have a clear vision for your future, or maybe you’re still exploring the possibilities. Either way, Stanford GSB will help you chart your course.
It’s not just about finding a job — it’s about launching a career that aligns with your vision, strengths, and values.
Work with Career Management Center (CMC) advisors and other career education professionals to create a customized career plan, develop your personal and professional skills, make strategic decisions, and achieve your goals. And this support won’t end when you graduate — you’ll benefit from Stanford GSB career resources throughout your life.
Think of the CMC as an ally in your job search, both while you are a student and beyond. We help by unlocking a valuable network, offering career resources, and providing one-on-one advising at every stage of your search. Here’s how:
Understand your values and strengths by taking an online self-assessment tool. Get insights into what motivates you.
Explore your career and lifestyle interests. Use design thinking methods to create and evaluate multiple plans for different career possibilities.
Work one-on-one with a Career Management Center advisor who understands you and your goals.
Get comprehensive information on industries, career specialties, market forecasts, and other job-related data.
Our alumni network is unparalleled in enthusiasm and generosity. Find alumni and peers who will take the time to discuss your career and life goals and will share their perspectives on industries, functions, companies, and more.
Gain confidence, polish your responses, and think on your feet with online resources, role-playing, and practice interviews.
Participate in a range of programs and events designed to help you explore your career options and equip you with the skills to get there. Choose programs that are best suited to your current needs and the future you envision.
Connect with employers often represented by GSB alumni at these major events:
Our comprehensive job board includes opportunities posted by employers interested in hiring our students as well as positions sourced by our employer engagement team based on your interests.
Attend valuable networking events including career panels, regional treks, networking receptions, and conferences.
Stanford has a strong network, especially in the climate space. You meet smart, capable people in classes and in the community. I started to think about what I want in my career, what really matters to me, and where my passion for climate comes from. You learn leadership and development of soft skills at Stanford, and the climate field will need new leaders who can turn ideas into reality. To do that you not only need scientific knowledge, but the capability of moving people, of recruiting talent, of coordinating teams, of promoting good teamwork. I knew Stanford would help me become the leader I want to be.

Career Impact










Stanford GSB provides a transformational experience that will change your life and the lives of those around you.
We guide you on your journey toward a life of meaning and a career with impact, equipped with the ideas, skills, experiences, and supportive community you need to succeed.
Every student’s journey is unique, but no matter where you are headed, we’ll be the propelling platform to get you there. Maybe you have a clear vision for your future, or maybe you’re still exploring the possibilities. Either way, Stanford GSB will help you chart your course.






Career Support
It’s not just about finding a job — it’s about launching a career that aligns with your vision, strengths, and values.
Work with Career Management Center (CMC) advisors and other career education professionals to create a customized career plan, develop your personal and professional skills, make strategic decisions, and achieve your goals. And this support won’t end when you graduate — you’ll benefit from Stanford GSB career resources throughout your life.
Think of the CMC as an ally in your job search, both while you are a student and beyond. We help by unlocking a valuable network, offering career resources, and providing one-on-one advising at every stage of your search. Here’s how:








  Explore


Self Assessments



Understand your values and strengths by taking an online self-assessment tool. Get insights into what motivates you.





Career and Life Design



Explore your career and lifestyle interests. Use design thinking methods to create and evaluate multiple plans for different career possibilities.





Personal Career Advising and Support



Work one-on-one with a Career Management Center advisor who understands you and your goals.





Current Industry Intelligence



Get comprehensive information on industries, career specialties, market forecasts, and other job-related data.





Stanford GSB Network



Our alumni network is unparalleled in enthusiasm and generosity. Find alumni and peers who will take the time to discuss your career and life goals and will share their perspectives on industries, functions, companies, and more.












  Prepare


Interview Preparation



Gain confidence, polish your responses, and think on your feet with online resources, role-playing, and practice interviews.





Workshops



Participate in a range of programs and events designed to help you explore your career options and equip you with the skills to get there. Choose programs that are best suited to your current needs and the future you envision.










  Launch


Employer Networking Events



Connect with employers often represented by GSB alumni at these major events:

“Fewer Than 300” Networking: An event for students to meet Bay Area employers with fewer than 300 employees. Talk to employers about their business plans and hiring needs.
Company Networking Events: We bring together some of our most popular employers — some focused on recruiting for post-Stanford GSB positions, others looking to fill internships.
Employer Presentations: Company leaders and recruiters describe their firms, discuss career opportunities, and answer questions at these informational forums.






Robust Job Board



Our comprehensive job board includes opportunities posted by employers interested in hiring our students as well as positions sourced by our employer engagement team based on your interests.





Student-Organized Club Events



Attend valuable networking events including career panels, regional treks, networking receptions, and conferences.













  Juan Rosenkrantz

MBA'24

Stanford has a strong network, especially in the climate space. You meet smart, capable people in classes and in the community. I started to think about what I want in my career, what really matters to me, and where my passion for climate comes from. You learn leadership and development of soft skills at Stanford, and the climate field will need new leaders who can turn ideas into reality. To do that you not only need scientific knowledge, but the capability of moving people, of recruiting talent, of coordinating teams, of promoting good teamwork. I knew Stanford would help me become the leader I want to be.


Show More 



















Marcia Austin


                      MBA ’22
